Module tagtraum.audioplayer4j
Package com.tagtraum.audioplayer4j

Interface AudioPlayer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AVFoundationPlayer, JavaFXPlayer, JavaPlayer
    public interface AudioPlayer
extends AutoCloseable
    Audio player.
    The easiest way to start playing audio is: 
     AudioPlayer.play(someURI);
    For more comprehensive scenarios, obtain an AudioPlayer instance via AudioPlayerFactory.open(URI). The player's state may be observed via PropertyChangeListeners, the played resource via an AudioPlayerListener.
    Author:
    Hendrik Schreiber

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int DEFAULT_MIN_TIME_EVENT_DIFFERENCE
      Default minimum delay in ms between "time" property events.

      • DEFAULT_MIN_TIME_EVENT_DIFFERENCE

        static final int DEFAULT_MIN_TIME_EVENT_DIFFERENCE
        Default minimum delay in ms between "time" property events.

    • Method Detail

      • open

        void open​(URI uri)
   throws UnsupportedAudioFileException,
          IOException
        Opens the audio resource with the given URI. In order to fully exploit different capabilities of different implementations, you might rather want to use AudioPlayerFactory.open(URI) instead.
        Parameters:
        uri - audio resource URI
        Throws:
        UnsupportedAudioFileException - if the stream does not point to valid audio file data recognized by the system
        IOException - if an input/output exception occurs
        See Also:
        AudioPlayerFactory.open(URI)

      • getURI

        URI getURI()
        URI of the audio resource to be played. May be null.
        Returns:
        uri, may be null

      • play

        void play()
   throws IllegalStateException
        Start playback of the loaded resource.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no resource is loaded
        See Also:
        isPaused()

      • play

        static void play​(URI uri)
          throws UnsupportedAudioFileException,
                 IOException
        Load and start playback of the given resource.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedAudioFileException - if the URI does not describe a playable audio resource
        IOException - if the URI cannot be accessed due to IO problems

      • pause

        void pause()
    throws IllegalStateException
        Pause playback of the loaded resource.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no resource is loaded
        See Also:
        isPaused()

      • isPaused

        boolean isPaused()
        Indicates whether the player is the paused state, i.e. it's not playing anything. Note that this method may return true, even if no resource is loaded.
        Returns:
        true or false

      • playPause

        void playPause()
        throws IllegalStateException
        Toggle playback, i.e. pause if the player is currently playing and start playback, if it's currently paused.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no resource is loaded

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset playback to the beginning of the resource.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no resource is loaded

      • getTime

        Duration getTime()
        Get current time.
        Returns:
        time
        See Also:
        setTime(Duration)

      • setTime

        void setTime​(Duration time)
        Ask the player to seek the desired time.

        Note that this method returns immediately, which does not mean that the player already reached the desired time. Concretely, getTime() may return a different value, when called immediately afterwards.

        Parameters:
        time - timestamp you wish to seek
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if time is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if time is negative
        IllegalStateException - if no resource is loaded

      • getDuration

        Duration getDuration()
        Get duration of the loaded resource.
        Returns:
        duration or null if no resource is loaded or the duration is unknown

      • getVolume

        float getVolume()
        Get volume on a linear scale of 0.0-1.0.
        Returns:
        volume

      • setVolume

        void setVolume​(float volume)
        Set volume on a linear scale of 0.0-1.0. If this player is currently muted, it is automatically unmuted, if the new volume != 0f.
        Parameters:
        volume - volume
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the volume is less than 0f or greater than 1f

      • getEffectiveVolume

        float getEffectiveVolume()
        Effective volume after application of gain (mute is ignored).
        Returns:
        effective volume
        See Also:
        getGain(), getVolume()

      • getGain

        float getGain()
        Get the currently set gain (in dB). The gain may be used to implement things like ReplayGain.
        Returns:
        gain in dB

      • setGain

        void setGain​(float gain)
        Sets the gain. This might be used to implement volume normalization schemes like ReplayGain.
        Parameters:
        gain - gain in dB

      • isMuted

        boolean isMuted()
        Indicates whether this player is currently muted
        Returns:
        true or false

      • setMuted

        void setMuted​(boolean muted)
        Turns muting on or off.
        Parameters:
        muted - true or false

      • getMinTimeEventDifference

        int getMinTimeEventDifference()
        Minimum delay in ms between "time" property events. This is not necessarily a precise, binding value. Instead, it is treated by the implementing player class as a non-binding user-wish.
        Returns:
        time in milliseconds

      • setMinTimeEventDifference

        void setMinTimeEventDifference​(int minTimeEventDifference)
        Minimum delay in ms between "time" property events.
        Parameters:
        minTimeEventDifference - time in milliseconds
        See Also:
        getMinTimeEventDifference()

      • setAudioDevice

        void setAudioDevice​(AudioDevice audioDevice)
             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the desired audio device.
        Parameters:
        audioDevice - audio device
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the device is not supported by this player

      • getAudioDevice

        AudioDevice getAudioDevice()
        Current audio device.
        Returns:
        currently used audio device

      • gainToVolume

        static float gainToVolume​(float gain)
        Convert dB gain to linear volume in the range 0.0-1.0. This means, too large a gain value may be clipped.
        Parameters:
        gain - gain in dB
        Returns:
        linear volume

      • volumeToGain

        static float volumeToGain​(float volume)
        Convert linear volume to dB gain.
        Parameters:
        volume - linear volume
        Returns:
        gain in dB
